Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.1: The word that the Lord hath spoken against Babylon, and against the land of the Chaldeans in the hand of Jeremias the prophet.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.2: Declare ye among the nations, and publish it, lift up a standard: proclaim, and conceal it not: say: Babylon is taken, <u>Bel</u> is confounded, Merodach is overthrown, their graven things are confounded, their idols are overthrown.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.3: For <u>a nation</u> is come up against her out of the north, which shall make her land desolate: and there shall be none to dwell therein, from man even to beast: yea they are removed, and gone away.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.4: In those days, and at that time, saith the Lord, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Juda together: going and weeping they shall make haste, and shall seek the Lord their God.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.5: They shall ask the way to Sion, their faces are hitherward. They shall come, and shall be joined to the Lord by an everlasting covenant, which shall never be forgotten.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.6: My people have been a lost flock, their shepherds have caused them to go astray, and have made them wander in the mountains: they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their resting place.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.7: All that found them, have devoured them: and their enemies said: We have not sinned in so doing: because they have sinned against the Lord the beauty of justice, and against the Lord the hope of their fathers.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.8: Remove out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans: and be ye as kids at the head of the flock.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.9: For behold I raise up, and will bring against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the land of the north: and they shall be prepared against her, and from thence she shall be taken: their arrows, like those of a mighty man, a destroyer, shall not return in vain.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.10: And Chaldea shall be made a prey: all that waste her shall be filled, saith the Lord.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.11: Because you rejoice, and speak great things, pillaging my inheritance: because you are spread abroad as calves upon the grass, and have bellowed as bulls.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.12: Your mother is confounded exceedingly, and she that bore you is made even with the dust: behold she shall be the last among the nations, a wilderness unpassable, and dry.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.13: Because of the wrath of the Lord it shall not be inhabited, but shall be wholly desolate: every one that shall pass by Babylon, shall be astonished, and shall hiss at all her plagues.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.14: Prepare yourselves against Babylon round about, all you that bend the bow: fight against her, spare not arrows: because she hath sinned against the Lord.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.15: Shout against her, she hath everywhere given her hand, her foundations are fallen, her walls are thrown down, for it is the vengeance of the Lord. Take vengeance upon her: as she hath done, so do to her.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.16: Destroy the sower out of Babylon, and him that holdeth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the sword of <u>the dove</u> every man shall return to his people, and every one shall flee to his own land.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.17: Israel is a scattered flock, the lions have driven him away: first the king of Assyria devoured him: and last this Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.18: Therefore thus saith the Lord of hosts the God of Israel: Behold I will visit the king of Babylon and his land, as I have visited the king of Assyria.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.19: And I will bring Israel again to his habitation: and he shall feed on Carmel, and Bason, and his soul shall be satisfied in mount Ephraim, and Galaad.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.20: In those days, and at that time, saith the Lord, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none: and the sin of Juda, and there shall none be found: for I will be merciful to them, whom I shall leave.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.21: Go up against the land of the rulers, and punish the inhabitants thereof, waste, and destroy all behind them, saith the Lord: and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.22: A noise of war in the land, and a great destruction.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.23: How is the hammer of the whole earth broken, and destroyed! how is Babylon turned into a desert among the nations!
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.24: I have caused thee to fall into a snare, and thou art taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware of it: thou art found and caught, because thou hast provoked the Lord.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.25: The Lord hath opened his armoury, and hath brought forth the weapons of his wrath: for the Lord the God of hosts hath a work to be done in the land of the Chaldeans.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.26: Come ye against her from the uttermost borders: open that they may go forth that shall tread her down: take the stones out of the way, and make heaps, and destroy her: and let nothing of her be left.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.27: Destroy all her valiant men, let them go down to the slaughter: woe to them, for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.28: The voice of them that flee, and of them that have escaped out of the land of Babylon: to declare in Sion the revenge of the Lord our God, the revenge of his temple.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.29: Declare to many against Babylon, to all that bend the bow: stand together against her round about, and let nose escape; pay her according to her work: according to all that she hath done, do ye to her: for she hath lifted up herself against the Lord, against the Holy One of Israel.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.30: Therefore shall her young men fall in her streets: and all her men of war shall hold their peace in that day, saith the Lord.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.31: Behold I come against thee, O proud one, saith the Lord the God of hosts: for thy day is come, the time of thy visitation.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.32: And the proud one shall fall, he shall fall down, and there shall be none to lift him up: and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all round about him.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.33: Thus saith the Lord of hosts: The children of Israel, and the children of Juda are oppressed together: all that have taken them captives, hold them fast, they will not let them go.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.34: Their redeemer is strong, the Lord of hosts is his name: he will defend their cause in judgment, to terrify the land, and to disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.35: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith the Lord, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.36: A sword upon her diviners, and they shall be foolish: a sword upon her valiant ones, and they shall be dismayed.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.37: A sword upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the people that are in the midst of her: and they shall become as women: a sword upon her treasures, and they shall be made a spoil.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.38: A drought upon her waters, and they shall be dried up: because it is a land of idols, and they glory in monstrous things.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.39: Therefore shall dragons dwell there with the <u>fig fauns</u>: and ostriches shall dwell therein, and it shall be no more inhabited for ever, neither shall it be built up from generation to generation.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.40: As the Lord overthrew Sodom and Gomorrha, and their neighbour cities, saith the Lord: no man shall dwell there, neither shall the son of man inhabit it.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.41: Behold a people cometh from the north, and a great nation, and many kings shall rise from the ends of the earth.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.42: They shall take the bow and the shield: they are cruel and unmerciful: their voice shall roar like the sea, and they shall ride upon horses: like a man prepared for battle against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.43: The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them, and his hands are grown feeble: anguish hath taken hold of him, pangs as a, woman in labour.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.44: Behold he shall come up like a lion from the swelling of the Jordan to the strong and beautiful: for I will make him run suddenly upon her: and who shall be the chosen one whom I may appoint over her? for who is like to me? and who shall bear up against me? and who is that shepherd that can withstand my countenance?
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.45: Therefore hear ye the counsel of the Lord, which he hath taken against Babylon: and his thoughts which he hath thought against the land of the Chaldeans: surely the little ones of the flocks shall pull them down, of a truth their habitation shall be destroyed with them.
Jeremiah or Jeremias__50.46: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth is moved, and the cry is heard amongst the nations.
